Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.add_process_time_header(request: Request, call_next)¶

The add_process_time_header function is a middleware function that adds the time it took to process the request in seconds;.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the request object

  • call_next – Call the next function in the pipeline

Returns:

The response object with a new header called &quot;process-time&quot;

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database is configured correctly.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with a message key

async main.root()¶

The root function is the entry point for the API. It returns a simple message to let you know that it works.

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is used for limiting the number of requests .

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database based on the id of that contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be returned

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact with the given id if it exists, otherwise none

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_birthdays(user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts who have birthdays in the next 7 days

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by(name: str | None, surname: str | None, email: str | None, user: User, db: Session)¶
The get_contacts_by function returns a list of contacts that match the given name, surname and email.

If no contact is found, an empty list is returned.

Parameters:

  • name – str | None: Filter the contacts by name

  • surname – str | None: Filter the contacts by surname

  • email – str | None: Filter the contacts by email

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was removed

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact data to be updated

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that we want to update

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated contact

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email address of the user

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to be used for this function

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

An object of type user or none

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – Get the user from the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is logged in

Returns:

A contactmodel object

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id of the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the current month.

The function takes two parameters: db and current_user. The db parameter is used to access the database, while the current_user parameter is used to get information about who’s logged in.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts who have birthdays in the next 7 days

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by(name: str | None = None, surname: str | None = None, email: EmailStr | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_by function returns a list of contacts that match the given name, surname and/or email. If no contact is found, an empty list is returned.

Parameters:

  • name – str | None: Search for a contact by name

  • surname – str | None: Filter the contacts by surname

  • email – EmailStr | None: Validate the email address

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The contact that was removed

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdate: Pass the contact information to be updated

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id of the current user

Returns:

The updated contact

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user object

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The user object

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email has been confirmed

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the credentials from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A new access_token and refresh_token

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message to the user

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: user and detail

REST API services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the access token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s data

async create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes in a dictionary of data and returns an encoded JWT token.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A jwt token

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s information to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function takes a refresh token and decodes it.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that was sent to the client

Returns:

The email of the user

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object if the token is valid

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email of the user that is encoded in the token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as an argument and returns the hashed version of that password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hashed password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and a hashed password as arguments.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method work for a specific instance of user

  • plain_password – Check if the password entered by the user is correct

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with the hashed password that is generated from a plain text password

Returns:

A boolean value

REST API services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link that they can click on to verify their email address.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Ensure that the email is a valid email address

  • username – str: Pass the username of the user to be used in the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object
